programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley are live asking for help with unsolved cases, and there is a profile of the team that police the world-famous Isle of Man TT races.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander explores a one-bedroom flat in London about to be auctioned, while Martin Roberts looks at a two-bedroom terrace house for sale in Abertillery in south Wales, and catches up with a project to renovate a pair of semi-detached properties in Walderslade in Kent.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: Paramedic Ste Hill attends a man suffering from a suspected anxiety attack, while colleague Mike Duggan assists a homeless man who has fallen in the street. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Police officers make a gruesome discovery on a farm where burglars have allowed wild boars to escape, and a thief robbing a supermarket invites her friends for a free shop.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Leominster in Herefordshire, where experts Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant advise two teams competing to win the greater profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: It is the day of the wedding, but doubts remain as to whether Shak will turn up, while Rob has to deal with the arrest of Bren.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton goes property hunting in North Devon for a couple whose search for a country home on a £325,000 budget has so far fallen short. He also learns about a unique local pigment, known as Bideford Black, and enjoys the artistic freedom of painting on the beach.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms and then sells three things about to be dumped at a tip in Witley, Surrey, before giving the profits to the people who were getting rid of the items. Items include some discarded oak and an old armchair. Narrated by Arthur Smith.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paul Martin and Danny Sebastian help locals in Monks Kirby, Warwickshire, by arranging a sale to raise funds for Carl Hodgetts, who has spina bifida. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Sally Philips host the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker hosts the light-hearted quiz, with sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey, wheelchair tennis star Jordanne Whiley, Olympic bronze medal-winning judoka Sally Conway and goalkeeper Mark Schwarzer joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Carters are all ready for Linda's surprise birthday party - but with Mick on edge and the unexpected arrival of Fi, it looks like things may not go as smoothly as they hope. Johnny enlists Patrick's support to persuade Derek not to leave Walford. Bex is torn when Sonia insists she moves into the new flat with her and Robbie - angering Martin in the process.(n)

programme.title: Count Arthur Strong
programme.desc: Arthur attempts to build bridges with a surprising figure from his past. Comedy, starring Steve Delaney and Rory Kinnear and featuring Graham Fellows in his guise as John Shuttleworth.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career, recalling his first appearance on Irish television and discussing a school reunion. There's trouble down at the Phoenix Club when Stars in Your Eyes gets cancelled, while Elton John makes a guest appearance.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes needs someone to look after Grandad so she can treat herself to a much-needed holiday - but with private nursing homes being so expensive, it seems her only option is to convince the health visitor he has lost his marbles. Rory and Dino move in for a couple of weeks, and the matriarch is soon spitting feathers when the latter begins taking over the house, and her late husband gets in touch from beyond the grave with some ominous news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham rounds off his current run with a compilation of highlights from the series. Clips feature Michael Caine, Morgan Freeman, Warren Beatty, Goldie Hawn, Patrick Stewart, Nicole Kidman, Ian McKellen, Tom Cruise, Judi Dench, Diane Keaton, Michael Fassbender and Hugh Jackman.(n)

programme.title: Entrapment
programme.desc: An elusive professional art thief suspected of stealing a priceless painting is pursued by an insurance agent. However, instead of bringing the criminal to book, she teams up with him to plot the robbery of a lifetime - although neither is sure the other can be trusted. Crime thriller, starring Sean Connery, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Ving Rhames, Will Patton and Maury Chaykin.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: The Hairy Bikers Si King and Dave Myers serve as hosts this weekend, inviting guest Alex James to sample dishes prepared in the studio by chefs Tim Siadatan and Elizabeth Haigh.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge demonstrates how to cater for a large gathering of guests at a special occasion. She prepares dishes for a buffet supper, including beef and mushroom stew with mustard mash, salmon en croute with salad, chocolate and orange panna cotta and a meringue tranche with berries and cream.(n)

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of the final from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, on the concluding day of the tournament. With Wimbledon set to begin on Monday, the finalists will look to go into the Grand Slam on a high by emulating the success of Dominika Cibulkova here last year, who claimed her first grass court title with a 7-5, 6-3 victory over Karolina Pliskova. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson tries to help two sisters who dream of escaping their urban homes and moving to the Devon countryside on a budget of £490,000. Away from the property search, Jules tries his hand at one of the county's oldest trades.(n)

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a family-themed edition of the quiz, featuring Louis Theroux and Nancy Strang, Michael Underwood and Angellica Bell, Calum and Angie Best, and Gary and Harry Lineker.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Peter Capaldi's tenure as the Doctor draws close to its conclusion, as the Mondasian Cybermen rise. Not seen since the classic, pre-2005 series, the original Cybermen came from Mondas, `Earth's twin planet', and posed a fearsome threat to the Time Lord and his companions. Now, these sinister cyborgs begin a new conquest, and the Doctor makes a final stand to protect a tiny band of humans from utter destruction. Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas also star as Bill and Nardole, Michelle Gomez reprises her role as Missy, while John Simm puts in an appearance as the Master. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the third heat of the choral music contest, as six more choirs and vocal groups battle for a place in the Grand Final. This time, Kings College London's All the King's Men, Polish jazz ensemble Alle Choir, the London International Gospel Choir, all-female soul act Songbird Sessions, Welsh choir Sgarmes, and the newly formed 4 Tune Tellers and Kimmy all seek to impress judges Gareth Malone, Kelis, and guest adjudicator Bebe Rexha. Plus, Pitch Battle's resident music director Deke Sharon opens the contest with a musical mash-up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The ED staff are surprised when Sam shows up to work in scrubs instead of his usual suit. He reveals he has stepped down as medical director, and is now joining the department as a speciality doctor. Dylan struggles to cope in the wake of Cal's death, and ends up having a panic attack while trying to treat a feisty retired nurse who admitted herself to hospital with a self-diagnosed heart attack. Luckily, David is on hand to reach out to the difficult patient, and get to the bottom of what's bothering Dylan.(n)

programme.title: Avengers Assemble
programme.desc: A mystical artefact is stolen from a top-secret military base by Thor's brother Loki, who plans to use it to bring about an alien invasion. Spymaster Nick Fury brings together a team of superheroes, including Iron Man, Thor, Captain America and the Hulk, to defend Earth from the impending attack. Action adventure uniting the Marvel comic-book characters, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Evans, Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo, Scarlett Johansson, Tom Hiddleston, Jeremy Renner and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Joseph, who plays viper-tongued Dorien in Birds of a Feather, joins Brian Conley to discuss how a production of David Copperfield and June Whitfield's comedy timing inspired her stage and television careers.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: The MERIT mobile trauma team are called into action to deal with a man who has been stabbed and hit in the head with a sledgehammer.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams of firefighters select antiques to take to auction in Newark, Nottinghamshire, helped by experts Richard Madley and Catherine Southon. Tim Wonnacott presents.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Mike Reid, Selin Kiazim and Tom Kemble continue the battle for a place at the Taste of Summer banquet, celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. This time, the three chefs are tasked to create a main course, with each choosing to use aspects of traditional summer barbecues as their inspiration.(n)

programme.title: Big Love
programme.desc: The story of James and Phil Lusted from north Wales, who have a rare form of dwarfism and are 3ft 7 and 3ft respectively. The film reveals how they managed to find love with women of average height, with both of them engaged to be married. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of day five from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, featuring the semi-finals. British number one Johanna Konta's fine run came to an end at this stage last year when she was defeated 6-7, 6-3, 6-3 by the Czech Republic's Karolina Pliskova. In the other last-four match, Puerto Rican qualifier Monica Puig was overwhelmed 6-2, 6-1 by Dominika Cibulkova. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of day five from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, featuring the semi-finals. British number one Johanna Konta's fine run came to an end at this stage last year when she was defeated 6-7, 6-3, 6-3 by the Czech Republic's Karolina Pliskova. In the other last-four match, Puerto Rican qualifier Monica Puig was overwhelmed 6-2, 6-1 by Dominika Cibulkova. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents the show from Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, with experts James Lewis and Elizabeth Talbot. Featuring a local sculptor who craves giant spiders.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Kate Humble hosts as team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by Vianet Djenguet and Steve Backshall for another test of wildlife knowledge. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin explore unusual homes built underground. In Greece, they view a house hidden beneath the landscape that still boasts stunning sea views. In the Swiss Alps, they visit a house made so invisible it has to be accessed via a tunnel. Next it's over to New Zealand's South Island to a house built underground to soften its impact on the landscape as well as withstand the threat of earthquakes, before the pair inspect a Dutch house created by deep excavation, which features a huge, light-filled open-plan living space. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Banquet.
programme.desc: The grand finale sees the winning chefs cook their dishes at the Taste of Summer banquet. On arriving at Wimbledon, they are greeted by Master of Ceremonies Dan Bloxham who gives them an exclusive behind-the-scenes tour. Once in the kitchen, they have to prepare the winning menu for guests including players and champions as well as those other workers who help deliver the Championships. From Tim Henman to Judy Murray, the guests are all expecting perfection. Determined to do their best, the chefs are feeling the pressure as judges Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort monitor their efforts. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty Don at Longmeadow to add more medicinal planting to the herb garden - especially those that bees love. She also investigates how gardeners can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators. Monty visits a garden in Herefordshire to see a collection of Siberian Iris, which inspires him to create a new Iris patch, adding warmth and splash of colour into his dry garden. The green-fingered experts also discover a garden containing a stunning collection of clematis Montana. Plus, Nick Bailey reveals how to plan, design and build a border fit for any garden, while in Somerset, Carol Klein visits the home of Margery Fish, the writer who exercised a strong influence on the informal style of the cottage garden, before her death in 1969.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: Direct from Pinewood Studios, the comedian tries to make sense of the modern world, using a combination of stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction to dissect the week's news - with guests including Sara Pascoe and Katherine Ryan prepared to take the Scotsman to task over his claims.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Jo Whiley and Mark Radcliffe introduce highlights from the festival at Worthy Farm in Somerset, including a reminder of some of the big performances, stories and moments from the weekend's events.(n)

programme.title: Mike and Jules: While We Still Have Time
programme.desc: Documentary about Jules Peters' battle with breast cancer and her personal journey through diagnosis, surgery and treatment with the support of husband Mike, frontman of the Alarm.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Friendship drives the Doctor to make the rashest decision of his many lives when, trapped on board a giant spaceship, caught in the event horizon of a black hole, he witnesses the death of someone he pledged to protect. For a man well-accustomed to bending the laws of time to his advantage, now every passing second seems to be leading to an awful loss beyond even his control. However, he remains determined to overcome the odds and redeem his mistake, but prevailing against time itself could be one battle too many for the Time Lord. Sci-fi adventure, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie, Matt Lucas and Michelle Gomez.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter T, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Carnival Story
programme.desc: A pickpocket joins a circus travelling through Germany and is seduced by a cruel barker. She gets a job as assistant to a devoted high dive jumper, who proposes to her, but is unable to forget her feelings for her heartless old lover, leading to a fatal conflict between the two men. Drama, with Anne Baxter, Steve Cochran and Lyle Bettger.(n)

programme.title: The Maggie
programme.desc: A brash American businessman hires a small Scottish company to move a set of valuable furniture to his new home on a remote island. However, he soon learns that his belongings are to be transported on a dilapidated boat in desperate need of repair - and sets out in hot pursuit of them. Ealing comedy, with Paul Douglas, Alex Mackenzie, James Copeland and Tommy Kearins.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty tries to track dolphins off the west coast of Ireland using sonar technology, recording the whistles and clicks they use to communicate with each other. He also visits Inishturk, one of the country's most remote inhabited islands, where he recruits the school's seven pupils as whale and dolphin watchers, enjoys a magical underwater encounter with seals and throws a party for the locals.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts surveys a Derbyshire mill worker's cottage, Lucy Alexander visits a father and daughter buying a Kent house, and Dion Dublin assesses a Suffolk investment property.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef and The Incredible Spice Men co-presenter Tony Singh joins Michel Roux Jr to prove that even in winter it's possible to eat well using seasonally available ingredients. Tony prepares a feast of venison with haggis ravioli, while Kate Goodman has a guide to matching whisky with food. Plus, author and broadcaster Stefan Gates joins in for a debate on food miles and their environmental impact.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams select antiques for auction in Newark, Nottinghamshire. Expert Catherine Southon has her patience tested to the limit with the tactical red team, while Richard Madley manages to lose his animal-loving blue team. Presented by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms narrates a retrospective look at the life of actor Peter O'Toole, using material from the BBC archive to reveal the highlights and milestones of his distinguished career.(n)

programme.title: Kidnapped
programme.desc: A boy who is the heir to a fortune is abducted and sent off to sea by his scheming uncle, who stands to get his hands on the family riches. However, the lad teams up with a Jacobite fugitive, and the pair embark on a perilous journey across Scotland to see justice done. Historical adventure, based on Robert Louis Stevenson's novel, starring Peter Finch and James MacArthur.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore faces a daunting tasks as she enlists furniture expert Jay Blades and dress designer Chinelo to help her turn a profit on seven rusty chairs and an old leather sofa.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value items at Blackpool Tower Circus. James Lewis examines an assortment of watches that have been in the back of a wardrobe for years and David Fletcher gets his hands on a pistol dating back to the Battle of Waterloo, however a collection of military medals could outshine them both. Paul looks around Lancashire's oldest family home and its antiques amassed by 14 generations.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty Don at Longmeadow to add more medicinal planting to the herb garden - especially those that bees love. She also investigates how gardeners can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators. Monty visits a garden in Herefordshire to see a collection of Siberian Iris, which inspires him to create a new Iris patch, adding warmth and splash of colour into his dry garden. The green-fingered experts also discover a garden containing a stunning collection of clematis Montana. Plus, Nick Bailey reveals how to plan, design and build a border fit for any garden, while in Somerset, Carol Klein visits the home of Margery Fish, the writer who exercised a strong influence on the informal style of the cottage garden, before her death in 1969.(n)

programme.title: The Day the Dinosaurs Died
programme.desc: Documentary examining whether an asteroid strike 66 million years ago triggered a worldwide catastrophe, killing off the dinosaurs and wiping out 75 per cent of all life on Earth. Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod joins a multimillion pound drilling expedition into the exact spot in the Gulf of Mexico that was the point of impact, while palaeopathologist Alice Roberts meets leading scientists to find if the effects could have wiped out dinosaurs across the world almost immediately.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Nature's Wildest Weapons: Horns, Tusks and Antlers: Natural World.
programme.desc: Professor Doug Emlen examines how animals use their bodies as weapons in epic battles to gore, stab, crush and batter their adversaries to death, from elephants to rhinoceros beetles, assessing whether they are more than just instruments of blunt force. For the professor this has been a lifetime's ambition to discover the secrets of nature's arms races, what triggers them and what they can teach us about the most formidable weapons on Earth - our own.(n)

programme.title: Manchester International Festival: Everyone Welcome
programme.desc: Lemn Sissay tours Manchester's biennial international arts festival, which takes on a more poignant tone in the wake of the terror attack at Manchester Arena in May. Featuring more than 60 new works by local and international artists, this year's festival looks set to maintain a tradition of offering daring and provocative perspectives on modern life, while also aiming to raise the city's spirits and provide fresh hope to its residents. Lemn previews the works on display, and gains access to rehearsals by New Order, Shunt Collective and Susan Hefuna.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Frazer is asked to look after the platoon's Lewis gun, but finds himself in hot water when he misplaces the spring - and fears it is has been left inside a coffin. Second World War comedy first shown in 1969, starring John Laurie, Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier.(n)

programme.title: Melvyn Bragg on TV: The Box that Changed the World
programme.desc: Ken Loach, Joan Bakewell, Trevor Phillips, Michael Grace, Martha Kearney, Ed Balls, Lyse Doucet and Alex Crawford join Melvyn Bragg as he explores the extraordinary impact British television has made on the nation's culture since its first great unifying moment - the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in 1953. Filmed at Bafta, Bragg and his interviewees highlight the way television has reflected and influenced Great Britain as a whole, challenging authority, redefining celebrity, and evolving the concept of democracy.(n)

programme.title: Sex & Drugs & Rock & Roll
programme.desc: Biopic of highly influential punk singer Ian Dury, examining his lifelong struggle with the disability caused by contracting polio as a child, and the impact his rise to fame in the late 1970s and volatile personality had on those closest to him, particularly his son Baxter. Starring Andy Serkis, Bill Milner, Naomie Harris and Olivia Williams.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Peter Powell introduce performances by Slade, Thompson Twins, Style Council, Shannon, Queen and Nena.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Roxy Music perform Ladytron in 1972.(n)

programme.title: The Good Old Days
programme.desc: A 1979 edition of the old-time music hall programme, chaired by Leonard Sachs. John Inman, Rita Morris, the Balladiers, John Wade, Julie Royce, Duo Barodies, Raymond Bowers and members of The Players' Theatre, London, entertain an audience from the stage of the Leeds City Varieties. First shown on March 1, 1979.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Compilation of archive performances, comprising tracks by the Moody Blues, the Faces and David Bowie, originally recorded for It's Lulu, Sounds for Saturday and The Old Grey Whistle Test.(n)

programme.title: Tom Jones' 1950s: The Decade That Made Me
programme.desc: Tom Jones fronts the first of four retrospective documentaries in which celebrated musicians look back at the decades that defined them. For Tom, that decade is the 1950s, the era following the austerity of the Second World War that saw a boom in popular culture, which swept aside the old order and ushered in a new era of entertainment. The veteran singer provides a first-hand guide to his formative years in a small mining community in south Wales, revealing how he - much like many people of his generation - turned to TV, movies, radio and music to find a voice for himself. Revisiting Treforest and Pontypridd, where he spent his childhood and teenage years, Tom recalls his joy when rationing finally ended, his encounter with American GIs stationed near his home, and the arrival of rock `n' roll and the `Teddy Boys'. Includes contributions by writers Joan Bakewell, Katherine Whitehorn and Michele Hanson, and historians Alwyn Turner, Dr Martin Johnes, Tony Russell and Francis Beckett.(n)

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.(n)

programme.title: Dusty Springfield at the BBC
programme.desc: A tribute to the renowned London-born pop diva, featuring BBC archive footage of some of Dusty's most famous performances from 1961 to 1995. The programme also offers a chance to relive the singer's story, from her folk beginnings with the Springfields, through to her Motown homage years and her collaboration with Pet Shop Boys in the late 1980s. Also includes the star's duets with Tom Jones and Mel Torme.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Peter Powell introduce performances by Slade, Thompson Twins, Style Council, Shannon, Queen and Nena.(n)

programme.title: Tom Jones' 1950s: The Decade That Made Me
programme.desc: Tom Jones fronts the first of four retrospective documentaries in which celebrated musicians look back at the decades that defined them. For Tom, that decade is the 1950s, the era following the austerity of the Second World War that saw a boom in popular culture, which swept aside the old order and ushered in a new era of entertainment. The veteran singer provides a first-hand guide to his formative years in a small mining community in south Wales, revealing how he - much like many people of his generation - turned to TV, movies, radio and music to find a voice for himself. Revisiting Treforest and Pontypridd, where he spent his childhood and teenage years, Tom recalls his joy when rationing finally ended, his encounter with American GIs stationed near his home, and the arrival of rock `n' roll and the `Teddy Boys'. Includes contributions by writers Joan Bakewell, Katherine Whitehorn and Michele Hanson, and historians Alwyn Turner, Dr Martin Johnes, Tony Russell and Francis Beckett.(n)

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.(n)

programme.title: Dusty Springfield at the BBC
programme.desc: A tribute to the renowned London-born pop diva, featuring BBC archive footage of some of Dusty's most famous performances from 1961 to 1995. The programme also offers a chance to relive the singer's story, from her folk beginnings with the Springfields, through to her Motown homage years and her collaboration with Pet Shop Boys in the late 1980s. Also includes the star's duets with Tom Jones and Mel Torme.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Compilation of archive performances, comprising tracks by the Moody Blues, the Faces and David Bowie, originally recorded for It's Lulu, Sounds for Saturday and The Old Grey Whistle Test.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The migration of elephant herds across Botswana's Kalahari Desert during the annual flooding of the Okavango Delta, which turns 4,000 square miles of arid plains into a maze of wetlands, setting the scene for great clashes between animals in search of water. Resourceful elephants make the most of stagnant pools and waterholes guarded by lions, while hippos converge on prime territories to do battle. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Kon-Tiki
programme.desc: Premiere. An anthropologist forms a theory that Polynesia was settled by explorers from South America prior to Christopher Columbus' expedition. To prove his claims are possible, he and a small crew sail a wooden raft across the Pacific using no modern technology. Fact-based drama, starring Pal Sverre Hagen and Anders Baasmo Christiansen. In Norwegian, English, French and Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Donna is astonished at the room rates, while David and Ewa are expecting nothing but perfection, but the self-service approach at breakfast confuses the guests, leaving Martin and Sara defiant in the face of their feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final two days see the contestants staying the night at Soar Chapel Guest House in Wales, the family home of mum and daughter Lesley and Chloe Priestly. Expectations are high for this duo and one guest in particular is not disappointed. Things get going in the afternoon during a beatboxing contest, although old tensions resurface at dinner and the hosts are left to calm things down. A massive spread is laid on at breakfast, but when one guest takes issue with the cooked items, Lesley and Chloe worry what impact it will have come payment day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed

David and Ewa Woodward want to challenge Martin's criticism over the way they run their business. Next, Donna Taylor wants to find out more about the issue that caused Martin and Sara to lose sleep. Plus, Paul catches up with last week's matches to discover whether their first dates were a success.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Bad TV
programme.sub-title: Best of Bad TV: Most Shocking Ever.
programme.desc: A romp through the most inappropriate, outrageous, ill-conceived and downright cringe-inducing moments that made it to air. Clips include steamy choreography courtesy of Pan's People, exercising for the elderly with fitness guru Sue Becker, an unlikely combination mix of daytime television and alcohol in a Christmas edition of Pebble Mill at One and programmes intended to shock such as Eurotrash, The Word and The Girlie Show. Contributors include Katy Puckrick, Sarah Cawood, Christine Hamilton, Paul Morley, Mark Dolan, David Quantick, Nina Myskow and Zoe Lyons.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother. Featuring games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat, as well as reactions to the latest eviction. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal has the latest developments and invites his studio audience and celebrity guests to discuss how the Big Brother housemates are getting on.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother. Featuring games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat, as well as reactions to the latest eviction. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.sub-title: GPs Behind Closed Doors: Best of Patient Files.
programme.desc: A man battling with cancer reflects on his progress, after admitting to doctors he would rather take his own life than endure a long decline. Meanwhile, a young man suffering from the rare Guillain-Barre syndrome discusses dealing with the debilitating condition, and a young woman who suffered a severe panic attack talks about her ongoing battle with mental illness.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton renovate neglected hallways in Hammersmith, west London, and Headingley in north Leeds. They move on to a bachelor's living room in desperate need of a tidy-up, where they install a Georgian fireplace and piano to replace the booze and ironing boards.(n)

programme.title: House Busters
programme.desc: Janet Ellis and her team of new-age practitioners suggest ways in which changes to homes could positively affect the lives of their owners.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: Salty Cove looks forward to a visit from the Queen, but there is great confusion when she arrives.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The puppet takes a trip to the seaside, where he builds sandcastles.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Bop Box
programme.desc: Jen, Amy and Olivia are transformed into princes and princesses for a medieval party.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Tickle and Mr Quiet fly in a helicopter, while Little Miss Calamity struggles to control a hot-air balloon.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her playgroup friends dress up as countries from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy teaches Peppa and George a game to play indoors while they wait for the rain to stop.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Peggy feels left out because all the baby penguins except her have had their own special day, so Wissper organises a party.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder entrusts the care of Adventure Bay to Robo-Dog while he and the Pups take a well-deserved break. But Robo-Dog runs amuck fixing things.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The team builds an outdoor TV area at the sports stadium, but Lofty gets distracted.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman tries to make his mum's birthday special by baking a cake with Mike. However, their good intentions end up causing a fire.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Stan and Olly are called to help when the school boiler breaks, so the pair decide to perform a rock n roll concert to raise money for a new one.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Stan enters his canine Ben in the Bumpton Dog Show. However, his pet injures his leg the day before so Olly tries to find a way for him to still take part in the competition.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: A fantasy fire-breathing dragon comes to life, and it will not let Ryder and the pups into the lookout.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Blaze visits Velocity Ville to compete alongside his new race-car friends in the Hundred Mile Race, but Crusher is competing too, and will do anything to win.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Runaway Animals.
programme.desc: All the farm animals escape and cause chaos in Toy Green. Noddy and his friends find that rounding then up and returning them to the farm is easier said than done.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Kevin the croc somehow manages to get stuck high up in a tree, when he finally works out how to get down, he invents a cracking new game for the monkeys.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The children visit a farm to find out where milk comes from.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Leah needs the genies' help when her bucket floats out to sea - which leads to a magical treasure hunt involving a talking parrot and a pirate ship.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster takes a splash in her new paddling pool on a hot day, and is soon joined by the entire household.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Everyone is excited to learn that Mummy Rabbit is pregnant.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Pedro Pony pretends to be a cowboy and tells stories in a camp he has set up in the garden.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig visits Peppa and George and brings seeds for them to plant, while Daddy Pig acts as a scarecrow.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly, Ben, Nanny and the King have to look after naughty twins Daisy and Poppy for the day.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Michelangelo befriends some odd, new superheroes named Wingnut and Screwloose.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Dogs Make You Laugh Out Loud 2.
programme.desc: Comedians Matt Richardson and Katy Brand present another selection of the most popular videos featuring dogs, while pet behaviourist Professor Peter Neville provides the scientific background. Featuring Bizkit's sleepwalking antics, which have notched up almost 33 million hits on YouTube, and footage of Norman the French sheepdog riding scooters, skateboards and bikes.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Gordon Morris leads a raid on the house of a suspected drug user, but the door won't budge. Meanwhile, Rich Woodward is in pursuit of a souped-up hot hatch, a late-night reveller kicks off in Nantwich town centre, and police dog Bonnie is used in the hunt for two runaways.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers come under attack from a gang of violent armed robbers, while Jon and Chris have their work cut out catching up with a dangerous speeder. Plus, the `Big Blue Van' respond to reports of bottles raining down on the streets and a routine stop on a delivery driver leads one of the interceptors to discover more than he bargained for.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Benefits Handout
programme.desc: Cameras continue to observe three families who were given £26,000 in return for coming off benefits. In Hull, Tony and son Michael start buying stock for their secondhand business, including two large slot machines. In Liverpool, Scott and Leanne go through their business plan, and elsewhere in the city, single mum Rachel talks to her friend Mary about how to look for a job when you have never had one.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: An Egyptian family who moved to a cul-de-sac in Hampshire - only to suffer racial abuse from their neighbour after complaining about his noisy TV. The documentary also features the story of a man who had not long moved into his Merseyside bungalow when his neighbour started banging on his wall and complaining about his loud music - which came as a surprise as he never played music. Plus, a woman who saw red after a battle to keep her Belsize Park home painted pink.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: Documentary following the plight of Warren and Sheree Smith and the problems they face with next door neighbour Harry Street. Single dad Steve Foster, and Rachel Ayre are among the residents who also reveal their issues with locals.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Stewart and Vic become party to a fractured family's school fee woes in Staffordshire and Del and Dael need to reclaim £3,500 after a rental van was returned badly damaged. Stewart and Elmor are in Warwickshire, where the members of a household blame their predicament on a scheming landlord whose subsequent arrival sparks a fierce reaction, while Iain helps Stewart remove a young mother from her Lancashire home.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Sheriff Paul Bohill tackles the case of a small debt owed by ex-footballer Neil `Razor' Ruddock to a kennel owner, before being forced to evict a school dinner lady in south London. Meanwhile, in the north of England enforcement agent Stewart MacCracken heads out with trainee Iain Taylor to confront a Yorkshire builder they need to get payment from at his home, while a reptile shop owner hit by online competitors urgently needs to pay a debt for the feed company he relies on to keep his animals alive.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.desc: Comedians Des Clarke and Katy Brand present a selection of the internet's most popular videos featuring dogs. Chica's pranks while dressed in a tarantula costume have received more than 130 million views online, while Denver was the star of a super-viral film in which the sight of a torn candy wrapper causes it to hang its head in shame. Meanwhile, Menswear Dog is a model and fashionista with its own Tumblr, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram accounts and earns around $15,000 a month from modelling contracts.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady seeks a would-be sweetheart for Arnold, who emigrated from Africa to Manchester, and served with the British Army in Afghanistan for nearly five years. Arnold's idea of a perfect date would involve a spin on the London Eye, and Paul gives three ladies a chance to woo the gentlemanly soldier. Meanwhile, finance director Gemma - also from Manchester - seeks an adventurous Prince Charming to settle down and start a family with. Plus, the host catches up with last week's couples, to find out whether that initial spark of attraction could develop into something more.(n)

programme.title: Greatest Celebrity Wind-Ups Ever
programme.desc: Joe Pasquale revisits some of the most hilarious celebrity pranks committed to film, with first-hand accounts from the people responsible for staging the tricks, and the unfortunate stars on the receiving end. Among the shenanigans highlighted are Ant and Dec giving James Corden his `worst day ever', Noel Edmonds springing a trap for an unsuspecting Lionel Blair, and magician prankster Ben Hanlin tricking boy band Blue into thinking they had killed one of their bandmates. Plus, Dom Joly relives the best of Trigger Happy TV, and Balls of Steel duo Olivia Lee and Mark Dolan recall the time they provoked the ire of Hollywood A-lister Tom Cruise.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: 20 Moments
programme.desc: A journey through the instances that rocked the genre and the fall-out that followed. Included is the occasion Will Young triumphed over Simon Cowell's favourite Gareth Gates on Pop Idol and the discovery of Cheryl Fernandez-Versini via Pop Stars: The Rivals. Plus, the memorable time Susan Boyle stepped out to sing I Dreamed a Dream on Britain's Got Talent and the tragic tale of Lena Zavaroni, the former child star winner of Opportunity Knocks. Contributors include Louis Walsh, Pete Waterman and Nina Myskow.(n)

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle UK
programme.sub-title: Lip Sync Battle UK: Rufus Hound v Jorgie Porter.
programme.desc: The musical game show sees comedian Rufus Hound and actress Jorgie Porter go head to head lip-synching to a hit song, complete with dance moves, facial expressions and costumes. Presented by former Spice Girl Melanie Brown and her co-host, rapper Professor Green.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Chilling mystery starring Kevin Bacon, based on a novel by cult author Richard Matheson. After being hypnotised, a man starts experiencing disturbing visions of a ghostly girl(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: In the wake of the detonation of a 'dirty bomb' in LA and under the instruction of a public service announcement, Brad barricades himself within his home. With his wife Lexi on her way to work, he desperately tries to call her in an attempt to find out if she is safe and well. As time elapses and his worse fear looks set to manifest, Lexi appears outside the family home..(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. Now, the adult Murdock has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios. Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante. And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: In 1974 scientists mixed extraterestrial DNA with human DNA to create a new species. The creature, now a young girl, escapes and mutates into a beuatiful young woman intent on seducing unknowing men(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: This lively black comedy turns the zombie movie on its undead head. Billy Connolly is a howl as a zombie who's been domesticated to do work around a suburban couple's home, where he befriends their young son. All goes well until his electrified collar goes on the fritz and he reverts to his bloodthirsty, flesh-eating ways(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding installment in the dystopian young-adult series, Thomas and the other Gladers journey across an obstacle-filled wasteland called the Scorch. Along the way, they search for information regarding the organization known as WCKD(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In Washington, D.C., in the year 2054, murder has been eliminated. The future is seen and the guilty punished before the crime has ever been committed. From a nexus deep within the Justice Department's elite Precrime Unit, all the evidence to convict - from imagery alluding to the time, place and other details - is seen by Pre-Cogs, three psychic beings whose visions of murder have never been wrong. It is the nation's most advanced crime force, a perfect system. And no-one works harder for Precrime than its top man, Chief John Anderton. Destroyed by a tragic loss, Anderton has thrown all of his passion into a system that could potentially spare thousands of people from the tragedy he lived through. Six years later, the coming vote to take it national has only fuelled his conviction that Precrime works. Anderton has no reason to doubt it... until he becomes its #1 suspect(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: A desperate mother seeks the help of a pair of priests, when her angelic daughter becomes possessed by a terrible demon. Horror(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A young thief named Bek (Brenton Thwaites) enlists the help of the powerful Egyptian god Horus (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) to overthrow the vicious deity Set (Gerard Butler), who has seized control of the land. Bek's true love has been captured, forcing the mortal rebel to fight back in order to free her and the people of Egypt from Set's tyrannical rule. This epic fantasy adventure was directed by Alex Proyas (The Crow), and co-stars Geoffrey Rush, Chadwick Boseman, and Courtney Eaton(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Rockstar Games' double-gunned action franchise comes to the big screen thanks to director John Moore (The Omen) and Mark Wahlberg, who embodies the title character of Max Payne, a widowed cop hell-bent on delivering justice no matter what the cost as he investigates a string of killings in his city. Mila Kunis and Chris O'Donnell head up the supporting cast, with Beau Thorne adapting the screenplay for the 20th Century Fox production(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: Director Guy Ritchie heads back to the London underworld in this crime comedy starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton. Wilkinson plays Lenny Cole, a Russian mobster who orchestrates a lucrative real estate scam. Greed is the universal language, and everyone from Cole to street-smart criminal One Two (Gerard Butler) and corrupt accountant Stella (Thandie Newton) seems to speak it fluently. Jeremy Piven and Chris Ludacris Bridges co-star(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Stephen Glass is a staff writer for the respected - current events and policy magazine - The New Republic, and a freelance feature writer for Rolling Stone Magazine and others. By the mid-90s, Glass' articles had turned him into one of the most sought-after young journalists in Washington D.C., but a bizarre chain of events suddenly stopped his careers path. Nominated for four Independent Spirit Awards and a Golden Globe(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. Now, the adult Murdock has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios. Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante. And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye(n)

programme.title: Halloween: Resurrection
programme.desc: In the chilling eighth installment of the series, a group of frightened teens tries to live through the night in killer Michael Myers' childhood home as part of an Internet contest set up by an entrepreneur (Busta Rhymes). Little do they know that someone is in the house waiting for them. Jamie Lee Curtis, Ryan Merriman, Bianca Kajlich, Thomas Ian Nicholas(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK Corral(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: David Wain's comedy stars Paul Rudd and Seann William Scott as a pair of irresponsible salesmen who find themselves acting as very unlikely role models for two wayward kids. Danny and Wheeler make their living promoting a high-energy drink to pupils as a wholesome alternative to drugs. The job fits perfectly with uber-slacker Wheeler's rock'n'roll lifestyle, while cynical Danny, whose focus is his girlfriend Beth, feels underused and that his life is dribbling away. However, neither men can find the motivation to grab life by the scruff - until, one day, they crash their truck and are given the choice between jail or community service. They choose the latter, becoming mentors to a 10-year-old breast-obsessed lad called Ronnie and teenage role-play gamer Augie. It's difficult to tell whose behaviour is worse, the children or the 'adults', but a battle of wills ensues, which will have a meaningful outcome for each of the quartet..(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Comedian Andy Kaufman gave performances that were bizarre and difficult to categorize, in which he might do or say almost anything: show cartoons, impersonate Elvis Presley, play conga drums while singing children's songs, read aloud from The Great Gatsby, or take the audience out for milk and cookies. Written by Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski and directed by Milos Forman (the team behind The People vs. Larry Flynt (1996)), this biopic takes an in-depth look at Kaufman's life and art, with Jim Carrey as Kaufman, who could (and would) be any number of different people onstage: the quiet and childlike man, the little foreign guy, the overbearing showbiz "professional," the violently obnoxious wrestler, or the world's worst lounge singer. As Kaufman rose from comedy clubs to guest appearances on Saturday Night Live and a spot on the TV sitcom Taxi, his performances became more complex and dangerous -- so much so that when word got out in 1984 that he was suffering from lung cancer, many fans and associates thought it was just another bizarre stunt; the disease took his life later that year. Man on the Moon features Danny De Vito as Kaufman's manager George Shapiro, Courtney Love as his girlfriend Lynne Margulies, Paul Giamatti as his friend Bob Zmuda, and David Letterman, Judd Hirsch, Marilu Henner, Carol Kane, and Christopher Lloyd as themselves(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Screen siren Cameron Diaz and former X-Man James Marsden star in the supernatural horror picture The Box (2008), directed by Donnie Darko cult fave Richard Kelly. The film's premise involves a strange and ominous box granted to a young couple by a mysterious stranger (Frank Langella). They are informed that pressing various buttons on the box will grant them riches while killing a person unknown to them in the process. Executive produced by Ted Hamm, the film was adapted by Kelly from Richard Matheson's 1970 short story Button, Button(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve a New York cop goes to Los Angeles to visit his estranged wife at her company's Christmas party, held on the top floor of a huge skyscraper. The building is invaded by terrorists, leaving the cop, who's escaped to the roof, as the other partygoers' only hope for survival(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Things aren't going well for John McClane: his marriage is breaking up, he's been suspended from the force and now the brother of Hans Gruber, the German terrorist he threw off a building a few years back, is threatening to blow up a school if McClane doesn't run around the city solving his demeaning and dangerous puzzles. With the help of Zeus, a Harlem electrician, McClane discovers Gruber's plot to distract the NYPD while he clears the federal bank of billions of dollars of gold(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: When internet terrorists try to bring the US to its knees by shutting down every major computer system, NYPD detective John McClane makes a stand. All-out action sequel(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: Unsettling mystery. A woman who was adopted as a baby returns to her family's home in remote Russia where sinister goings on see her and her estranged twin trapped inside an eerie old house(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: When he has a vision of his flight to Paris crashing, a teen travelling with his French club makes a scene and they are all kicked off the airline. The plane goes down and the survivors are grateful, but Death hunts them down(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Chilling mystery starring Kevin Bacon, based on a novel by cult author Richard Matheson. After being hypnotised, a man starts experiencing disturbing visions of a ghostly girl(n)

Wilkinson plays Lenny Cole, a Russian mobster who orchestrates a lucrative real estate scam. Greed is the universal language, and everyone from Cole to street-smart criminal One Two (Gerard Butler) and corrupt accountant Stella (Thandie Newton) seems to speak it fluently. Jeremy Piven and Chris Ludacris Bridges co-star(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Stephen Glass is a staff writer for the respected - current events and policy magazine - The New Republic, and a freelance feature writer for Rolling Stone Magazine and others. By the mid-90s, Glass' articles had turned him into one of the most sought-after young journalists in Washington D.C., but a bizarre chain of events suddenly stopped his careers path. Nominated for four Independent Spirit Awards and a Golden Globe(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. Now, the adult Murdock has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios. Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante. And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye(n)

programme.title: Halloween: Resurrection
programme.desc: In the chilling eighth installment of the series, a group of frightened teens tries to live through the night in killer Michael Myers' childhood home as part of an Internet contest set up by an entrepreneur (Busta Rhymes). Little do they know that someone is in the house waiting for them. Jamie Lee Curtis, Ryan Merriman, Bianca Kajlich, Thomas Ian Nicholas(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK Corral(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: David Wain's comedy stars Paul Rudd and Seann William Scott as a pair of irresponsible salesmen who find themselves acting as very unlikely role models for two wayward kids. Danny and Wheeler make their living promoting a high-energy drink to pupils as a wholesome alternative to drugs. The job fits perfectly with uber-slacker Wheeler's rock'n'roll lifestyle, while cynical Danny, whose focus is his girlfriend Beth, feels underused and that his life is dribbling away. However, neither men can find the motivation to grab life by the scruff - until, one day, they crash their truck and are given the choice between jail or community service. They choose the latter, becoming mentors to a 10-year-old breast-obsessed lad called Ronnie and teenage role-play gamer Augie. It's difficult to tell whose behaviour is worse, the children or the 'adults', but a battle of wills ensues, which will have a meaningful outcome for each of the quartet..(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Comedian Andy Kaufman gave performances that were bizarre and difficult to categorize, in which he might do or say almost anything: show cartoons, impersonate Elvis Presley, play conga drums while singing children's songs, read aloud from The Great Gatsby, or take the audience out for milk and cookies. Written by Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski and directed by Milos Forman (the team behind The People vs. Larry Flynt (1996)), this biopic takes an in-depth look at Kaufman's life and art, with Jim Carrey as Kaufman, who could (and would) be any number of different people onstage: the quiet and childlike man, the little foreign guy, the overbearing showbiz "professional," the violently obnoxious wrestler, or the world's worst lounge singer. As Kaufman rose from comedy clubs to guest appearances on Saturday Night Live and a spot on the TV sitcom Taxi, his performances became more complex and dangerous -- so much so that when word got out in 1984 that he was suffering from lung cancer, many fans and associates thought it was just another bizarre stunt; the disease took his life later that year. Man on the Moon features Danny De Vito as Kaufman's manager George Shapiro, Courtney Love as his girlfriend Lynne Margulies, Paul Giamatti as his friend Bob Zmuda, and David Letterman, Judd Hirsch, Marilu Henner, Carol Kane, and Christopher Lloyd as themselves(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Screen siren Cameron Diaz and former X-Man James Marsden star in the supernatural horror picture The Box (2008), directed by Donnie Darko cult fave Richard Kelly. The film's premise involves a strange and ominous box granted to a young couple by a mysterious stranger (Frank Langella). They are informed that pressing various buttons on the box will grant them riches while killing a person unknown to them in the process. Executive produced by Ted Hamm, the film was adapted by Kelly from Richard Matheson's 1970 short story Button, Button(n)

programme.desc: Water Tower. After several months' worth of reruns, That '70s Show suddenly returned with five new episodes in the summer of 1999 to close out the series' first season. Dissatisfied with the results, Kelso (Ashton Kutcher) scrambles up the tower again, only to plunge painfully to earth. Rather than take Kelso to a hospital, Eric (Topher Grace) reasons that his mom, Kitty (Debra Jo Rupp), a nurse, is in closer proximity. programme.title: Easy A
programme.desc: Will Gluck's intelligent and hilarious high school comedy stars Emma Stone in an outstanding lead performance. Olive Penderghast is something of an 'also ran' in her year at school, so when she spies the opportunity to make herself look a little more interesting and mature she jumps at it and tells a friend that she's lost her virginity to a college boy. However, what was supposed to be a confidential white lie becomes public, and soon she has the cachet of unprecedented notoriety around the entire school. But it's what happens next that's really interesting. Enjoying the glare of attention (despite the brickbats some of her more prudish classmates hurl), she not only sets out to build on her newfound rep as a scarlet woman, she also subverts the moment to help some of the school's more picked-upon students. The film references a host of teen movies, as well as American novelist Nathaniel Hawthorne's 1850 work The Scarlet Letter, but ultimately it's the quality of Stone's acting, allied to a very funny script, that makes this such an enjoyable watch(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs

Beverly invites Lainey and Bill to Thanksgiving dinner so that Barry won't split his time between two households, but her plans soon go awry. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey.(n)

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny's TV breaks down, so she heads to the boys' flat to watch her favourite shows. However, Sheldon tires of her presence and bans future visits, leading to an embarrassing form of retaliation. Meanwhile, Howard and Raj search for the America's Next Top Model house.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: A smitten Howard becomes convinced he has met his soulmate in the form of surgeon Stephanie Barnett, but he fails to realise she is far more interested in Leonard. Less Than Perfect's Sara Rue guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is delighted that Leonard has finally managed to find a girlfriend who meets his high standards, but his over-exuberance looks set to cause problems. Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard turns to Penny for advice when his relationship with Stephanie takes off faster than he would have liked, and he realises he is the last person to notice that she has moved in with him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette annoys his friends as Christmas approaches. Meanwhile, Leonard is thrilled to meet an award-winning scientist, only to be filled with jealousy when his new colleague takes an interest in Penny. With guest star Michael Trucco (Battlestar Galactica, One Tree Hill).(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and the gang are excited when Barry Kripke challenges them to a robot duel. Meanwhile, Howard is devastated when Penny finally tells him what she thinks of his chauvinism. Guest starring John Ross Bowie.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon decides to put his formidable brain power to use in devising a scientific procedure for making friends. However, to prove his findings he must first win the trust of fellow scientist Barry Kripke to gain access to a powerful computer. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and John Ross Bowie.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny runs into money troubles, so Sheldon offers to lend her some cash to help her pay the rent. However, when Leonard discovers his neighbour's ex-boyfriend Kurt is the cause of her financial woes, he gathers the gang for a confrontation. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Thor
programme.desc: The Norse god of thunder is banished from his own world when his arrogance puts the kingdom on the brink of war. He is sent to present-day Earth, where he is forced to live among humans without his supernatural powers, but must regain his abilities to defend his new home against his evil brother. Kenneth Branagh's fantasy adventure based on the Marvel comics, starring Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Tom Hiddleston and Anthony Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The four lads decide to play truant from sixth form and buy alcohol for an all-day drinking session, which is interrupted when Neil's father comes home early. Meanwhile, Simon decides to declare his love for Carli through graffiti, and the friends face the wrath of their parents.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Simon passes his driving test, so the lads decide to take a trip to a theme park. However, things start to go wrong when their route is obstructed by a funeral cortege and the newly qualified motorist has an accident in the car park. Later, Will regrets ever making the journey when he disgraces himself on a rollercoaster.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on more TV from May, 2017, including Twin Peaks: The Return, Britain's Got Talent, First Dates, Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life, Andrew Neil's interview with Theresa May, and the News. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Great White Matrix
programme.desc: Navy diver and shark attack survivor Paul De Gelder and cameraman Andy Casagrande document the mysteries of modern shark science, including the drivers of predatory behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to South Africa to join a veterinary team trying to help a rhino called Thandi who was attacked by poachers for her horn. For the first time, a plastic surgeon will attempt a skin graft on the animal to heal the wound. She also visits the rainforest of Borneo to follow the story of an orangutan who needs cataracts removing from her eyes so that she can be released back into the wild. Elsewhere, vet Steve Leonard takes a trip to Chicago's Lincoln Park Zoo, where the latest technology is being used to help chimpanzees with heart disease. He also visits the South African city of Pretoria, where a Cape fur seal requires a CT scan to identify the root cause of her illness, and a giraffe urgently needs to be anaesthetised to treat a leg injury.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.sub-title: Tigers About the House - What Happened Next.
programme.desc: First of a two-part programme catching up with zookeeper Giles Clark and the Sumatran tiger cubs he was hand-rearing in his home in the suburbs of Queensland. Spot and Stripe are approaching their first birthdays and Giles has his hands full guiding them from adolescence into adulthood, while Spot faces uncertainty about his eyesight and his relationship with Stripe. The Clarks also make a big decision to safeguard the cub's wild cousins, with Giles, his wife Kerri and son Kynan embarking on a road trip through Indonesia with the aim of helping to protect endangered species.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how the competition to breed creates scenes of the most extraordinary beauty, as well as some of the most violent battles seen in nature. A male flame bowerbird shows off its artistic prowess to impress a potential mate - but if that does not prove enough, it will demonstrate its dancing skills instead. Waved albatrosses pair up for life and spend hours in each other's company, although things are not so simple for a male peacock jumping spider - one wrong move in its dazzling courtship routine could prove fatal. However, one of the most magnificent displays of all is created by a tiny male pufferfish, which impresses the ladies by building a spectacular underwater `crop circle' in the sand - arguably the most perfect and complex structure created by any animal.(n)

programme.title: Great White Matrix
programme.desc: Navy diver and shark attack survivor Paul De Gelder and cameraman Andy Casagrande document the mysteries of modern shark science, including the drivers of predatory behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Frontier Borneo
programme.desc: Researchers set out on a treacherous hike, hoping to capture video footage of the Danum Valley's most elusive wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Frontier Borneo
programme.desc: The documentary exploring life on the remote island of Borneo continues, as the children of the Bajau Laut reluctantly attend the new school built for them.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House

programme.desc: First of a two-part programme catching up with zookeeper Giles Clark and the Sumatran tiger cubs he was hand-rearing in his home in the suburbs of Queensland. Spot and Stripe are approaching their first birthdays and Giles has his hands full guiding them from adolescence into adulthood, while Spot faces uncertainty about his eyesight and his relationship with Stripe. The Clarks also make a big decision to safeguard the cub's wild cousins, with Giles, his wife Kerri and son Kynan embarking on a road trip through Indonesia with the aim of helping to protect endangered species.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to South Africa to join a veterinary team trying to help a rhino called Thandi who was attacked by poachers for her horn. For the first time, a plastic surgeon will attempt a skin graft on the animal to heal the wound. She also visits the rainforest of Borneo to follow the story of an orangutan who needs cataracts removing from her eyes so that she can be released back into the wild. Elsewhere, vet Steve Leonard takes a trip to Chicago's Lincoln Park Zoo, where the latest technology is being used to help chimpanzees with heart disease. He also visits the South African city of Pretoria, where a Cape fur seal requires a CT scan to identify the root cause of her illness, and a giraffe urgently needs to be anaesthetised to treat a leg injury.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how the competition to breed creates scenes of the most extraordinary beauty, as well as some of the most violent battles seen in nature. A male flame bowerbird shows off its artistic prowess to impress a potential mate - but if that does not prove enough, it will demonstrate its dancing skills instead. Waved albatrosses pair up for life and spend hours in each other's company, although things are not so simple for a male peacock jumping spider - one wrong move in its dazzling courtship routine could prove fatal. However, one of the most magnificent displays of all is created by a tiny male pufferfish, which impresses the ladies by building a spectacular underwater `crop circle' in the sand - arguably the most perfect and complex structure created by any animal.(n)
