programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to Japan where she visits inventor and vet Dr Keiichi Ueda. The vet has dedicated the past 12 years of his career to helping a dolphin called Fuji who has no tail as a result of a bacterial infection and he is hoping that a new prosthetic tail will enable her to swim properly again. Steve Leonard heads to the rainforest of Laos, where Edinburgh Zoo vet Romain Pizzi is undertaking keyhole surgery on a endangered moon bear called Champa who suffers from excess fluid on her brain. Steve then visits Florida where reptile specialist Doug Mader is using the latest technology to save Martha, an alligator with a badly blocked gut. Clare and Steve also follow the stories of a Galapagos tortoise with a mystery illness, a five-ton elephant suffering from an infected tusk and a tiger that keeps having nose bleeds.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: Following the yearly migration of 1,000 polar bears through a small town in Canada, and the visitors that they bring. A new season begins in Manitoba.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: The bear guides face some difficult clients that could put people at risk.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: It is peak migration season and one hungry bear has its sights set on a passing polar bear cub.(n)

programme.title: Valkyrie
programme.desc: Based on actual events, ¿Valkyrie¿ goes back to the Nazi Germany during WWII as the tide turns in favor of the Allies. A proud military man, Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg (Tom Cruise) desperately plots to topple the Nazi regime before the nation is crushed in a near-inevitable defeat. Realizing that time is running out, he decides that he must take action himself and joins the German resistance. Armed with a cunning strategy to use Hitler's own emergency plan - known as Operation Valkyrie - von Stauffenberg and his men plot to assassinate the dictator and overthrow his Nazi government from the inside(n)

programme.title: Nick & Norah's Infinite Playlist
programme.desc: High school student Nick O'Leary, member of the Queercore band The Jerk Offs, meets college-bound Norah Silverberg when she asks him to be her boyfriend for five minutes(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: An ex-Playboy Bunny becomes house mother to a sorority of geeky misfits after she is ousted from the Playboy Mansion. The girls desperately need to attract more members or they will lose their house, but can their new member make them cool without compromising their true selves?(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: John Candy, Rick Moranis, Bill Pullman and Dom DeLuise rocket into orbit in this side-splitting Mel Brooks excursion where good and evil forces grapple in an out-of-this-world galaxy(n)

programme.title: The X-Files
programme.desc: Mulder and Scully must fight the government in a conspiracy and find the truth about an alien colonization of Earth(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Stoner comedy about a pothead who witnesses a drug-related hit and goes on the lam with his dealer(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: John Candy, Rick Moranis, Bill Pullman and Dom DeLuise rocket into orbit in this side-splitting Mel Brooks excursion where good and evil forces grapple in an out-of-this-world galaxy(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: Sent once more to Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, to cover the annual Groundhog Day festival, television weatherman Phil Connors finds himself stuck in time, endlessly repeating February 2nd. Trying to make the best of his absurd situation, Phil becomes both master and victim of his peculiar predicament. With no tomorrow to worry about and plenty of time on his hands, Phil gets to explore some of his favourite fantasies, becomes an expert at all things trivial and pointless, gets lucky with the local girls and continually strikes out with the real love of his life. Reduced to a shadow of his former self, Phil finally makes the discovery that transforms him, enabling him to climb out of the longest day in comic history(n)

programme.title: Nine Months
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a man who fears that his idyllic five-year relationship is about to change when his partner becomes pregnant. His anxiety seems to be well-founded when he becomes involved with a couple of well-meaning but overbearing parents and his partner is put in the care of a Russian physician whose obstetrics experience is questionable. Will he make it through the next nine months with his sanity intact?(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: As American soldiers go to war in 1943, Tom Hanks is hired to coach a team of female baseball players, including Geena Davis and Madonna. Can they win over a sceptical public?(n)

programme.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
programme.desc: Critically successful and beloved cult teen drama from the master of the genre, John Hughes. Starring Mary Stuart Masterson as the working class misfit, Lea Thompson as the popular girl and Eric Stolz as the best friend(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: An ex-Playboy Bunny becomes house mother to a sorority of geeky misfits after she is ousted from the Playboy Mansion. The girls desperately need to attract more members or they will lose their house, but can their new member make them cool without compromising their true selves?(n)

programme.title: Running Scared
programme.desc: Distinguished by a sharp, witty dialogue between its two cop protagonists, Ray and Danny (Gregory Hines and Billy Crystal), this entertaining crime drama is well worth a visit. Ray and Danny are nearly blown away by super bad guy Julio (Jimmy Smits), and their boss is peeved at them as usual. So the two are given a holiday from their beat in Chicago and travel to the sunny shores of Key West. They like it enough to retire from police work and open a business there. But when the duo returns to the Windy City, Julio is about to pull off a big drug deal and retirement may not be such a good idea(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: Sent once more to Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, to cover the annual Groundhog Day festival, television weatherman Phil Connors finds himself stuck in time, endlessly repeating February 2nd. Trying to make the best of his absurd situation, Phil becomes both master and victim of his peculiar predicament. With no tomorrow to worry about and plenty of time on his hands, Phil gets to explore some of his favourite fantasies, becomes an expert at all things trivial and pointless, gets lucky with the local girls and continually strikes out with the real love of his life. Reduced to a shadow of his former self, Phil finally makes the discovery that transforms him, enabling him to climb out of the longest day in comic history(n)

programme.title: Navy SEALs
programme.desc: This exercise in patriotic, high-tech action centers on a select group of Navy commandos and their battles against a Middle East terrorist group. This particular squadron is led by a pair of rivals: cocky, fiery Hawkins (Charlie Sheen) and stoic, unflappable Curran (Michael Biehn). When an anti-terrorist mission goes awry, allowing an enemy leader to escape with a supply of stolen American missiles, both men are certain that, given another chance, they can redeem themselves and the squad. Their rivalry plays out against a background of high-powered amphibious battles, allowing the film to revel in dangerous stunts and advanced weaponry. Joanne Whalley-Kilmer provides brief romantic relief as a journalist with important information, but the focus remains on the macho interplay between Hawkins and Curran. Co-written by former Navy Seal Chuck Pfarrer (with Gary Goldman), the film presents authentic details about the elite unit, but the bulk of Navy Seals tends to rely on familiar combat film conventions. Viewers seeking rapidly paced action sequences will not be disappointed, though other viewers may be less likely to overlook the predictable storyline and routine characters(n)

programme.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
programme.desc: Critically successful and beloved cult teen drama from the master of the genre, John Hughes. Starring Mary Stuart Masterson as the working class misfit, Lea Thompson as the popular girl and Eric Stolz as the best friend(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: Tom Cruise plays Cole Trickle, a young hot-shot stock car racer determined to make it as top gun if he can find the right cocktail of car and manager, who comes along in the guise of racing legend Harry Hogge (Robert Duvall). As the pair tour the circuits, the competition builds to a climax in Daytona and a showdown between Trickle and his arch-rival Russ Wheeler (Cary Elwes), who will stop at nothing to beat him. Tony Scott's all-action film captures the all-out excitement and speed of the sport, while Nicole Kidman as Dr Claire Lewicki provides the love interest(n)

programme.title: For Love of the Game
programme.desc: Romantic drama about a washed-up baseball player who, on the morning of the final game of the season, finds out that his girlfriend is leaving to live in London and his team's new owners plan to trade him. As he pitches for the last time, he is torn - in a series of flashbacks - between the game he adores and the woman he loves(n)

programme.desc: Two men battle for control of 19th-century Hong Kong as a powerful outpost for the British Empire(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: The orphaned Amsterdam Vallon returns to New York seeking vengeance on Bill the Butcher, the gang leader who killed his father. Spectacular epic set in the savage ganglands of 19th-century Manhattan(n)

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: An expectant couple are sentenced to a high-tech prison in a futuristic society where population growth is state-controlled(n)

programme.desc: Johnny Messner, Kadee Strickland, Matthew Marsden, Morris Chestnut, Nicholas Gonzalez. (2004) Sequel with Matthew Marsden in which a team of scientists go in search of a flower which causes immortality. The local anacondas have already discovered its properties. Dir: Dwight H Little(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Artifact hunter and archaeologist extraordinaire Ben Franklin Gates learns of his own family's implication in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln by John Wilkes Booth. Gates must then locate an elusive diary, not only to clear his family's name, but to unearth and connect several secrets, buried within the book, that point to a massive, global conspiracy(n)

programme.desc: Disturbing sci-fi thriller by cult director David Cronenberg and starring Jude Law. A virtual reality computer game designer finds her life in danger and must unravel a sinister conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Ninja III: The Domination
programme.desc: Christie, an aerobics instructor, is possessed by the spirit of an evil ninja. The spirit uses Christie's body to murder the officers responsible for his death, and he can only be stopped by good ninja Yamada. The third installment in the Cannon "Ninja" Trilogy(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Diamonds in the Dust. In the Season 2 opener, the Team transports explosives to a Zimbabwe diamond mine whose owner was killed trying to make the delivery(n)

programme.title: No One Lives
programme.desc: Ryuhei Kitamura, director of The Midnight Meat Train, delivers this twisting tale of terror concerning a missing heiress, a gang of vicious bandits, and a vacationing couple who aren't what they seem. In the wake of a bloodbath that left 14 students dead, wealthy heiress Emma (Adelaide Clemens) has vanished without a trace. A few months later, a young couple (Luke Evans and Laura Ramsey) cross paths with the ruthless Hoag (Lee Tergesen) and his band of thieves, who run them off of the road in a violent robbery attempt. When Hoag and his crew learn that the mysterious couple has taken Emma hostage, they assume they'll be collecting a handsome reward. Little do they realize they've just gotten in deep over their heads, and as the body count spikes, the real fight for survival begins(n)

programme.title: Malone
programme.desc: On his way to start a new life, an ex-CIA agent gets caught up in a small town run by an ambitious millionaire who oppresses the inhabitants with fear. Meanwhile, the man has to fend off active agents who are trying to eliminate him(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Fast-paced action thriller in which a young family on a white-water rafting adventure in Montana are taken hostage by a pair of dangerous fugitives. The rafting holiday turns into a nightmare when two armed killers take control and try to force the mother, a proficient rafter, to use her skills to help them to escape down the treacherous rapids(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Four teenagers accidentally run over a stranger and hide the body rather than inform the authorities, only to find themselves stalked the following year by a shadowy figure who takes great delight in disposing of them in a variety of gruesome ways. Horror, starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr and Anne Heche(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Adrian is hired by a Mob boss to catch the gunman responsible for shooting dead five of his enforcers in a barber's shop - but he gradually realises the organised crime angle is actually irrelevant to solving the case. Guest starring Philip Baker Hall (Magnolia).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Members of the Northern California Symphony Orchestra come under suspicion when a violinist is murdered, and Cho encounters a young pickpocket. Crime drama, starring Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part series finale, a bank robber's suicide bombing outside a petrol station convenience shop leaves Jane suspecting there is more to the case than meets the eye. The incident is linked to the discovery of the body of a torture victim, and it transpires he was related to Hightower - who appears to be the target of serial killer Red John. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a high-profile model, killed with the unusual weapon of poisoned hair conditioner. While suspicion initially falls on the victim's film-star husband, the case proves more complicated than expected. The detective is also reunited with an old boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a Russian prostitute - and discovers some very famous names on her list of clients. When one of the prime suspects is given an alibi by the FBI, she discovers he is a pawn in a larger investigation. The detective also struggles with her feelings for Fritz.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at an apartment building brings navy officer Terence Keith to the team's attention and it transpires he had been on medication for anxiety, a condition that had led to him being ejected from a pilot's training course. Ducky's profile of Keith suggests that he may be unstable and about to exact revenge for having his dream of becoming a fighter ace taken away from him, and evidence points to him intending to carry out a suicide attack.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part series finale, Hightower wants to hand herself in, knowing she will be found innocent of Todd Johnson's murder, but Jane dissuades her, not wanting to risk scaring Red John underground. The consultant manages to inform all four suspects of her location and awaits the arrival of the accomplice, who he will use to track down the serial killer - only for Lisbon to get injured in the ploy. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is taken into custody for fatally shooting the man he believed to be serial killer Red John, but bluffs his way out of jail and tries to exonerate himself. He begins by visiting his victim's widow - and learns her house contains not only a secret room, but also a reluctant guest. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda looks into a series of gang shootings that appears to have been carried out by a military sniper. She accepts the help of a retired marine colonel when he comes forward with information about the murders - but begins to believe he knows more than he is letting on. Drama, with Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: An investigation is launched into the murder of a psychiatrist involved in the trial of a drug designed to treat teenage depression and anxiety. Meanwhile, Brenda's squad learns she was charged with sexual misconduct in her previous job in Atlanta. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is found murdered and Gibbs and McGee are called in when she is discovered to be carrying ID bearing the name Sgt Patricia Moreno, a US marine known to have died several years earlier. The victim is discovered to have come to America from Afghanistan and a necklace reveals a fingerprint that leads the team to a known assassin. Guest starring Lolita Davidovich.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate when naval cryptanalyst Andrew Wells is shot dead in a park outside Baltimore. At the scene, Tony spots a man who was one of his informants from 15 years earlier when he was a police officer, but who went into hiding after a bid to bring down the Russian mobsters he worked for went wrong. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb plot is uncovered following a death at a Quantico reunion, and tensions in the squad room cause trouble for Torres and Quinn as they settle into their new jobs.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The TAC team must formulate a new defence strategy after discovering a jury has a subconscious gender bias against a female pilot accused of negligence after a crash.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A girl at a day-care centre steals Stewie's heart, and Peter persuades Lois to become a flight attendant so he can enjoy the benefits of free air travel around the world. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter gets on the wrong side of socially inept gangster Big Fat Paulie, putting Lois in the sights of a hitman. The Griffins visit the Mob boss on the day of his daughter's wedding in the hope that he will call off the killing. Animated comedy, with the guest voice of Michael Chiklis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan returns home from another dangerous mission to find Francine and the family have decorated the house for Christmas. Deciding their efforts do not live up to his high standards, he sets out to find the perfect tree, but meets an untimely end during his search, and battles the forces of evil to save his loved ones and earn another chance at life.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine pretends to kidnap Roger after he has a fight with Stan, hoping to demonstrate how much he means to the family. However, when her agent husband refuses to pay the ransom, the alien is forced to rethink the way he treats people.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A spate of accidents around the house leads Lois to believe it is time Stewie began potty-training, much to the matricidal infant's chagrin. However, Brian is soon revealed as the true culprit - and his therapist attributes the problem to the erudite dog's love for his best friend's wife.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter teams up with Cleveland, Joe and Quagmire to win the coveted Golden Clam award for their Harvest Festival pageant float - but the prize comes between the old buddies. Meanwhile, Stewie is taken into care.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger becomes a bounty hunter and embarks on a cross-country manhunt with the help of Stan, determined to capture Hayley's boyfriend Jeff, who is wanted for smuggling drugs into Florida.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine is furious when she discovers that Stan has used government resources to artificially insert memories of happy vacations into the family's minds.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian goes to collect Stewie from Lois's parents' house in Palm Springs - but the duo lose their plane tickets in an airport bar, and find themselves with no choice but to stow away on board a train back to Quahog. Meanwhile, the Griffins try to spice up their marriage.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A new drug craze hits town, prompting Peter to assume the guise of new student Lando Griffin to eradicate the problem at Meg's school, where he extols the virtues of clean living with a song-and-dance routine inspired by Grease. Animated adventure, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan's friends are shocked to learn that he has never killed anyone, despite his high-octane career. Roger and the guys rally round to help him get off the mark.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine becomes a surrogate mother for gay neighbours Terry and Greg, prompting an outraged Stan to kidnap the baby once she is born. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger think Klaus is out to get them.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Sacramento County cops find a handgun and drugs concealed on a suspicious cyclist, and in Amarillo, a woman with outstanding warrants risks being arrested to protect her family.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers from the Sacramento County Sheriff's Department pursue a suspected phone thief over fences and through a field, and a road rage incident in Washington turns violent.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team are called in when a Navy reservist returns home to find her husband missing and her living room covered in blood, and make a grim discovery when they find a finger in the bin. Meanwhile, Ziva ruffles a few feathers by insisting on continuing her investigation into the murder of her father, asking for permission to go to Rome on the trail of the chief suspect. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New Mossad director Orli Elbaz asks for the team's help in finding Ilan Bodnar when one of her agents is shot dead in Virginia, telling Gibbs he was investigating several operatives who had gone rogue after Eli David's death. Ziva travels with Tony to Berlin in her pursuit of Bodnar, the man she believes was responsible for the death of her father. Guest starring Marina Sirtis (Star Trek: The Next Generation).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tracks Bodnar's SUV to a remote house in the countryside, but inside find only his dead accomplice - identified as a South African mercenary who helped Bodnar procure diamonds. Ziva and Tony, meanwhile, discharge themselves from hospital and wheedle information out of Abby to continue investigating on the quiet, having been warned by Homeland Security to stay off the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A cook from a US Navy destroyer tells McGee and Gibbs he believes someone is stalking him with the intention of trying to make him poison the crew, and a picture on a stolen phone leads the team to a group testing the psychological effects of surveillance. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks (Gus Grimly in the Fargo TV series).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American naval crime drama returns, joined by a new recruit played by Jennifer Esposito. The team investigates a deadly car explosion in DC that seems to be connected to Special Agent Nick Torres's disappearance six months earlier, while on a deep-cover operation in Argentina.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb plot is uncovered following a death at a Quantico reunion, and tensions in the squad room cause trouble for Torres and Quinn as they settle into their new jobs.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Agent LaRoche suspects Hightower of the murder of a police killer, who was burned to death in custody, after she reveals that she was sleeping with one of his victims. Jane also discovers that the head of CBI is linked to the death of an archaeology professor, prompting him to jeopardise his own career to help clear her name. Crime drama, starring Pruitt Taylor Vince and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane believes a doctor's murderer was a fellow physician, and discovers the victim was the head of a transplant unit. He is convinced wealthy people are being given preferential treatment at the hospital where the medic worked, but his sleuthing lands him in trouble with a patient's gun-wielding bodyguard. Elsewhere, Lisbon is demoted following a slip of the tongue. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The agents track down the killer of a man who believed he was abducted by aliens, and the case becomes more complicated when his body is stolen from the coroner's van. Van Pelt takes time off from the investigation to shop for a wedding dress. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The owner of an exclusive dating website is murdered, and although Jane is certain the victim's wife is to blame, she is released due to a lack of evidence. When holes begin to appear in her alibi, the consultant discovers a way to convict her of the crime, while the rest of the team learns that some of the women at the agency are filming their encounters with wealthy men so they can blackmail them. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane deals with two failed robberies, one resulting in the murder of a repair shop owner, and the other involving a former suspect the consultant hired to break into LaRoche's home. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: Criss-Cross Applesauce: The Ballard of Billy Jesusworth.
programme.desc: When Roger breaks his ankle, Francine convinces Stan to let him play in his basketball league.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan discovers a valuable salt deposit beneath the Smiths' back garden, but when he tries to sell the mining rights, he discovers he signed them over to Steve years ago.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Jeff and Hayley announce they would like to have a baby, and Stan takes the prospect of becoming a grandfather badly. Meanwhile, Steve plans to become a responsible uncle.(n)

programme.desc: Peter and Carter go to Africa to get their money back after they are swindled in an e-mail scam, while Brian pursues Meg's friend Patty.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Halloween arrives, and Peter joins forces with Joe to play a series of painful pranks on his friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Brian teaches Stewie the basics of trick-or-treating, and Meg has high hopes for her first festively themed high-school party.(n)

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
programme.desc: A group of interstellar outlaws team up to save the galaxy from a villain who seeks ultimate power in this comic book space adventure from Marvel Studios and director James Gunn (Slither, Super). Peter Quill was just a young boy when, devastated by his mother's death, he sprinted out of the hospital and was swept into the stars by Yondu (Michael Rooker), the leader of an eclectic band of space scavengers known as The Ravagers. Twenty-six years later, Quill has adopted the nickname Star Lord (Chris Pratt). He's broken away from The Ravagers in an attempt to track down an ancient orb that is also coveted by the evil Ronan (Lee Pace), who is in league with the dreaded Thanos, and who dispatches his top assassin Gamora (Zoe Saldana) to retrieve it from Star Lord. In the process of doing so, Gamora also gets drawn into a fight with furry bounty hunter Rocket (voice of Bradley Cooper) and his tree-like, humanoid companion Groot (voice of Vin Diesel). Subsequently thrown into prison, this unlikely quartet quickly makes the acquaintance of fearsome warrior Drax the Destroyer (Dave Bautista), who seeks bitter revenge for the slaughter of his entire family at the hands of Ronan. In the process of making a daring prison break, Star Lord, Gamora, Rocket, Groot, and Drax recover the orb, and transport it to The Collector (Benecio Del Toro), who reveals that it houses an Infinity Gem - one of six precious stones that harbors incredible powers that could pose a dire threat should they fall into the wrong hands. Later, Ronan acquires the Infinity Gem and plots to use its power to destroy The Nova Corps home-world of Xandar, The Guardians of the Galaxy must race through the stars to recover it before Ronan can carry out his genocidal plan(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mayored to the Mob. Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) and his family check out Springfield's Bi-Monthly Sci-Fi Convention, and the fans are buzzing in anticipation of an appearance by Luke Skywalker himself, actor Mark Hamill. Always looking for a photo op, Mayor Quimby (also voiced by Castellaneta) stops by to have his picture taken with Hamill, and when a scuffle breaks out, Homer comes to the rescue, escorting the mayor and the actor to safety. Quimby promptly fires his staff of bodyguards and hires Homer to take their place; after taking a crash course in the art of protecting others, Homer is now the mayor's first line of defense against enemies. Homer is on hand when Quimby makes a deal with local crime boss Fat Tony (voice of Joe Mantegna) to provide milk for town's schools, but he soon learns that the milk comes from rats, not cows, and Homer forces the mayor to expose Fat Tony's dirty dealings. This earns the enmity of Fat Tony, and the gangster is determined to take Quimby out of the picture as the mayor enjoys a dinner theater performance of +Guys and Dolls, with Hamill cast as Nathan Detroit. "Mayored To The Mob" first aired on December 20, 1998(n)

programme.title: Prometheus
programme.desc: A team of space explorers embarks on a fantastic voyage to the edge of the universe after making a profound discovery that hints at the true origins of the human race in this belated pseudo-prequel to director Ridley Scott's 1979 sci-fi classic Alien. Isle of Skye, Scotland: 2089. Archeologists Elizabeth Shaw (Noomi Rapace) and Charlie Holloway (Logan Marshall-Green) discover a cave drawing featuring a mysterious star pattern not found in our solar system. Upon comparing the image with similar other ones found at different archeological digs all over the planet, the pair realizes that they all match perfectly. They're convinced that the image is an invitation, and set out on a high tech Weyland Industries ship called Prometheus to - just maybe - unlock the mysteries of mankind's origins on Earth. Flash forward to Christmas Day, 2093. The crew of Prometheus awakens from stasis to learn they have arrived at their destination. With highly-intelligent android David (Michael Fassbinder) assisting the mission, and chilly Weyland representative Meredith Vickers (Charlize Theron) calling the shots, Captain Janet (Idris Elba) brings the ship down to the surface, landing next to a line of awe-inspiring structures that appear to have been built by intelligent beings. But when a small crew led by Elizabeth and Charlie explore the remote planet, the artifacts they find threaten to contradict everything mankind had been taught about its origins. But there's a secret in this chamber that's lain dormant for centuries, and now that it senses life, it finally sees an opportunity to escape. If it does, the trip that was supposed to answer al of our biggest questions about life could also be the one that seals the fate of every living creature on planet Earth(n)

However, when they find her, she refuses to leave and they have to take her by force - ending in a cross-border chase with the outlaws on their trail. Western adventure, with Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan, Woody Strode, Jack Palance and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

programme.title: The Train
programme.desc: As the Allies look set to liberate Paris from the Nazi forces, the Germans resolve to take all they can from the city - and plot to transport national treasures back to Berlin. However, bold French Resistance forces vow to stop them, enlisting the help of a train inspector along the way. Second World War adventure, starring Burt Lancaster, Paul Scofield, Jeanne Moreau and Michel Simon.(n)

programme.title: The Odessa File
programme.desc: The detailed diaries of a former inmate of a concentration camp fall into the hands of an investigative journalist. Incensed by what he reads, he embarks on a crusade to discover the prison commandant's new identity and expose his crimes to the world. In the process, the trail leads him to a secret organisation that helped Nazi SS officers escape justice. Thriller, based on Frederick Forsyth's novel, starring Jon Voight, Derek Jacobi and siblings Maria and Maximilian Schell.(n)

programme.title: Morning Glory
programme.desc: A TV producer fired from a news station takes over running an early morning TV show which is on the brink of cancellation. She tries to revive its flagging fortunes by hiring a foul-tempered veteran news reporter as the new host, only to find he and his co-presenter loathe each other. Comedy, with Rachel McAdams, Harrison Ford and Diane Keaton.(n)

programme.title: R.I.P.D

Teaming up with a Wild West lawman, he is sent back to Earth to prevent ghosts from causing chaos and uncovers a plot to overrun the land of the living with evil spirits. Fantasy adventure, with Ryan Reynolds and Jeff Bridges.(n)

programme.title: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter
programme.desc: A young man destined to become one of America's greatest presidents witnesses his mother being killed by a vampire, and devotes his life to battling the undead. As he rises to take his place in the White House during the Civil War, he discovers the bloodsuckers are the real power behind the Confederacy. Fantasy thriller based on Seth Grahame-Smith's novel, starring Benjamin Walker and Dominic Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Stripes
programme.desc: Two layabouts enlist in the US army in the mistaken belief that a modern serviceman's life is the equivalent of a luxury holiday. However, the pair quickly realise military duty is much more rigorous than either of them could ever have imagined, while a jaunt in a commandeered high-tech vehicle creates an international incident when they cross into enemy territory. Comedy, with Bill Murray, Harold Ramis, Sean Young, Warren Oates, John Candy and Judge Reinhold.(n)

programme.title: Stuart Little

However, their jealous cat hatches a plot to get rid of the new arrival. Comedy adventure, starring Geena Davis and Hugh Laurie, with the voice of Michael J Fox.(n)

Martin Scorsese's family adventure, starring Asa Butterfield, Chloe Grace Moretz and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.desc: Roger Mooking is on the hunt for lip-smacking ribs, and he found two places where the racks of meat stack up to perfection.(n)

programme.title: Jamie & Jimmy's Food Fight Club
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty open a seaside cafe in Southend, Essex, inviting friends, locals and celebrity guests to try their culinary creations. The pair also hit the road, travelling around Europe to find out how the nation's favourite dishes stack up against foreign alternatives. In the first edition, comedian and chat-show host Alan Carr drops by the cafe, and Jamie and Jimmy compare a range of British and French cheeses.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps the owner of Athena Mediterranean Cuisine in Brooklyn where its dwindling customer base is beginning to suggest that business and family are a bad mix.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team investigate rumours of a misbehaving restaurant mascot at Zippy's Giant Burgers in Seattle.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owners of a Seattle restaurant ask the team to investigate rumours that members of his staff are offering haunted tours of the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples pizzas with homemade toppings and crepe-filled lasagne in Detroit, citrus-glazed pancakes in Virginia Beach and massive pork-belly sandwiches in Chicago.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Visiting a Polish restaurant in Detroit, classic dishes in Virginia Beach, and an innovative diner in Vancouver.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine faces the challenge of addressing trust issues at Mama Campisi's Restaurant, owned by Andrea and Lance, where business is spiralling.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A restaurant owner has a problem with an employee who claims he injured his leg while at work and asks the Mystery Diners for help.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of a Moroccan-themed restaurant in California asks for help as he believes his manager might have a gambling problem.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten demonstrates a Jewish-themed dinner.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten cooks a meal inspired by French cinema.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares lunch for a group of hungry builders.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten demonstrates easy but sophisticated recipes, including zucchini vichyssoise, Asian grilled salmon and pear clafouti.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares food with herbs, including lemon-rosemary scones, French onion soup with fresh thyme, a panzanella salad with basil, and a minty raita with salted naan wedges.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's bakes a caramel apple pie and a frozen grasshopper pie, as well as strawberry pretzel pie and mini blueberry galettes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares sides for the Thanksgiving feast, including broccoli wild rice casserole, sweet 'taters, and dressing with Brussels sprouts.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummonds celebrate the completion of their new office with a shrimp cocktail bar with three sauces, plus spicy Italian meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and sweet brownie pops.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver provides tips on hosting a barbecue and demonstrates simple rules that guarantee properly cooked food every time. He also shows the best ways to cook everything on the grill, including chicken, ribs and shellfish, before revealing his recipe for the perfect marinade.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver steers away from the tourist trails in Venice as he explores the gastronomy of the Italian city. He prepares spaghetti vongole for a group of local fishermen, is taught the art of the perfect risotto by Ruggero Bovo, samples prosecco and cooks a bellini with beef carpaccio. The chef also tries his hand at minestrone with vegetables before being joined by old friend Gennaro Contaldo to make a Venetian tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman tries to consume a milkshake weighing just over 7lb and a 24oz sandwich in an hour in Washington, DC.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Michigan, where he gathers a team to help him consume a 30in-tall burger weighing more than 13st.(n)

programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Tony Luke's in South Philadelphia, where he faces their Ultimate Cheesesteak Challenge.(n)

programme.desc: Adam Richman takes on the Hellfire Challenge in Salt Lake City, in which he must consume a platter of extremely spicy sushi rolls and three other fiery dishes.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Primal Scene, So to Speak.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy has relationship problems and Jean frets when Judith starts dating a married man. At a dinner party attended by Penny and Stephen, Lionel has to steer the conversation away from personal matters. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: We Have Put Her Living in the Tomb.
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret agree to pet-sit a tortoise for a friend who ought to know better, and an anniversary outing to the theatre ends in disaster. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty.
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg.
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream.
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil goes to great lengths to prove to Sybil that a guest has smuggled a woman into his room. Instead the hotelier keeps being caught in compromising situations with a young Australian woman, and a visiting psychiatrist finds his increasingly manic behaviour both fascinating and alarming. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1979, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy has relationship problems and Jean frets when Judith starts dating a married man. At a dinner party attended by Penny and Stephen, Lionel has to steer the conversation away from personal matters. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: As Barry tires of golf and looks for a new hobby, Billy's latest idea of an archery course is right on target. Long-running comedy series, starring Mike Grady, Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Man Who Invented Yorkshire Funny Stuff.
programme.desc: Howard is dismayed when Marina unwittingly buys him a life-like gorilla which attracts the attention of the local police. Meanwhile, a newspaper article prompts Truly, Clegg and Billy to try to track down Cyril Cooper - a man renowned for his green fingers and womanising ways. Comedy, starring Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom finds himself suffering a bad back during harvest time, which leaves Barbara to do all the work on her own - a situation made worse by the terrible weather. Sitcom, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers

Classic comedy first broadcast in 1979, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: A loud-mouthed, abrasive American comes to stay at the hotel and soon exposes Basil's ignorance of transatlantic cuisine - particularly Waldorf salad. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney dates an artist who turns out to be the daughter of the Duke of Maylebury. Del sees the chance for the Trotter family to marry into the aristocracy, and disastrously gatecrashes a party at the Duke's country estate. Christmas special from 1986, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A hypnotist is booked to provide the entertainment at the triplets' baptism - and Agnes soon finds herself under his spell. Meanwhile, the matriarch's kitchen is falling apart - but that turns out to be the least of her problems when son Mark delivers some heartbreaking news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy goes to extreme lengths to impress her psychologist boyfriend, much to Agnes's disgust, while Rory locates the perfect apartment for him and Dino - the problem is, it's in Kilbride, meaning he'll have to learn to drive. Mark prepares to emigrate to Australia. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: The TV licence inspector calls round so Bridget puts the house into lockdown. How long can they hold out with the supply of cigarettes running out? Comedy, starring Jennifer Zamparelli and Bernard O'Shea.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Comedy about two zoo keepers at dilapidated tourist attraction Bob Fossil's Zoo-niverse. Howard agrees to take on a deadly kangaroo in a boxing match. Vince decides they need intensive training, some jazzy tracksuits and the aid of his bare-knuckle fighter uncle to turn Howard into a champion, but when all that fails it's up to Naboo the local mystic to save the day.(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Daisy is obsessed with her new dog Colin, leaving Tim feeling hurt and neglected - until the pesky pet is kidnapped by an evil vivisectionist. Overcome with guilt, Tim marshalls his friends together to launch a daring raid on the scientist's laboratory. Comedy, starring Jessica Hynes and Simon Pegg, with Bill Bailey and Charles Dale (Casualty).(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Tim's hedonist friend Tyres takes the gang clubbing. Amid the cacophony of whistles and repetitive beats, Daisy and Tim's friendship gets a chance to blossom - while Brian is forced to face a nightmarish memory from his past. Surreal comedy, starring Simon Pegg, Jessica Hynes, Mark Heap and Nick Frost.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: More comedy sketches from the award-winning team as a boxing toddler is forced by her parents to throw a fight, beefeaters riot on the streets of Britain, a campaign to ban the tiger is initiated, and the cockney gangster movie Alright Mate? receives its UK premiere. Starring Simon Pegg and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: More comic sketches from the award-winning team, including a babysitter who gets a surprise when she looks after Dame Margot Fontaine and a reassessment of US involvement in the Vietnam War. Simon Pegg, Mark Heap, Tracy-Ann Oberman, Rebecca Front and Kevin Eldon star.(n)

programme.title: The Armando Iannucci Shows

programme.title: We're Doomed! The Dad's Army Story
programme.desc: Comedy drama based on the story of how Jimmy Perry and David Croft brought the sitcom Dad's Army to life. Running from Perry's initial idea in 1967 until the transmission of the first episode in 1968, the film shows the beginnings of their writing partnership and the casting woes, personal clashes and production difficulties that put the show's existence in jeopardy. Starring Paul Ritter and Richard Dormer.(n)

programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?.
programme.desc: An old friend returns from Australia flushed with success and offers Del a share in his business empire Down Under. Although the prospect is tempting, it would mean leaving Nelson Mandela House and little brother Rodney behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del encounters an old flame from almost 20 years previously, and Rodney experiences the joys of dating - but the brothers soon face awkward questions from the past. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Diane Langton (The Rag Trade).(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Eight more contenders enter the kitchen, where Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace challenge them to make a dish of their own invention using a selection of seven ingredients - including crab meat, sea purslane, mango, ricotta and coconut. They each have just one hour to hold their nerve and demonstrate their creativity to the judges.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw heads to the Tohuku region, where he goes to sea with fishermen who caught a record-breaking tuna and meets the soy-sauce maker who saved many of his staff from the 2011 tsunami.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their biscuit-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking their own interpretation of a classic, the contestants face the task of baking brandy snaps. Preparing a display of macaroons forms the final leg of the challenge, before the judges reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Six more amateur cooks compete for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final. They prepare a plate of food that represents who they are as their calling card and choose one box of ingredients - either sweet or savoury - to rustle up a surprise dish in the invention test - after John Torode demonstrates what he would do with the same produce. Two are then sent home, leaving the remaining four to serve dinner for 2007 and 2012 MasterChef champions Steven Wallis and Shelina Permalloo respectively, as well as 2006 finalist Dean Edwards, before John and Gregg Wallace decide who has made it through.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore Britain's fondness for picnics, preparing an alfresco lunch at Beaufort Polo Club in the Cotswolds. They also discover how the habit of outdoor dining in summer evolved into its current form, celebrate snacks such as Cornish pasties and Scotch eggs, and bake a Dundee cake.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi's culinary journey takes him to Tunisia, where he dines on fresh fish, discovers the national obsession with fiery harissa paste and samples spicy merguez sausages. He begins with a visit to an open-air restaurant set in an idyllic cove and managed by a hermit, and serves grilled red mullet with a lemon and celery salad, before travelling to a seaside cafe, where he tries making brik - a fried pastry snack containing soft egg and tuna.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein Tastes the Blues
programme.desc: The chef charts how the culinary and musical traditions of the Mississippi Delta have intertwined throughout history, and learns about the people who live along the river's banks. He visits restaurants, bars and famous concert venues to trace the stories of the region's colonial past and the famous musicians who shaped the evolution of the blues.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their biscuit-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking their own interpretation of a classic, the contestants face the task of baking brandy snaps. Preparing a display of macaroons forms the final leg of the challenge, before the judges reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Six more amateur cooks compete for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final. They prepare a plate of food that represents who they are as their calling card and choose one box of ingredients - either sweet or savoury - to rustle up a surprise dish in the invention test - after John Torode demonstrates what he would do with the same produce. Two are then sent home, leaving the remaining four to serve dinner for 2007 and 2012 MasterChef champions Steven Wallis and Shelina Permalloo respectively, as well as 2006 finalist Dean Edwards, before John and Gregg Wallace decide who has made it through.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche.(n)

programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Stockholm.
programme.desc: The chef explores what makes Scandinavian food so popular as she visits Stockholm, where she is inspired by traditional Swedish baking.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Eight more contenders enter the kitchen, where Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace challenge them to make a dish of their own invention using a selection of seven ingredients - including crab meat, sea purslane, mango, ricotta and coconut. They each have just one hour to hold their nerve and demonstrate their creativity to the judges.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw heads to the Tohuku region, where he goes to sea with fishermen who caught a record-breaking tuna and meets the soy-sauce maker who saved many of his staff from the 2011 tsunami.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: The chef visits the Saturday farmers' market in Richmond, North Yorkshire, and prepares beef stew with mashed potato, followed by raspberry and white chocolate sherry trifle.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: After a visit to the Whitby fish market, the chef prepares cod with mango chutney, bean sprout salad and Thai crab risotto.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals on a budget, offering tips on keeping costs down and wasting less food. Beginning with recipes that work out at less than £1.80 a portion, he cooks up a roast brisket of beef with all the trimmings, Korean stir-fried rice, and sweet pea fish pie, before showing a takeaway lover how to make his favourite treat for a fraction of the price of ordering it in.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals for an average of £1.30 a portion. He cooks a roast half shoulder of pork with all the trimmings before turning the leftovers into dim sum buns, and rustles up meatloaf with spaghetti and a tomato and chilli sauce. The chef also shows a takeaway lover how to make a vegetable korma with cauliflower pilau for a fraction of the price of ordering it in, and helps a woman put all the meat in her freezer to good use instead of wasting it.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals for around £1.55 a portion. He cooks up a roast side of salmon with all the trimmings and uses the leftovers in a filo pie, before showing a takeaway lover how to make a lamb burger for a fraction of the price of his usual Friday night fast-food treat. Plus, a woman receives tips on putting unwanted bread to good use.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares roast chicken with all the trimmings, before turning the leftovers into a stew with dumplings, and rustles up cauliflower and broccoli cheese using frozen vegetables. The chef also demonstrates a recipe for making lamb koftas on a budget and shows a woman how to use up the fruit she normally throws away.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary journey by sea and land to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures. He begins in Cambodia, where tourists are beginning to return after the fall of the Khmer Rouge regime. As well as discovering the joys of freshly caught swimmer crabs with green peppercorns, he learns how to cook the country's most famous dish - fish amok - and samples lok lak, made with marinated beef. He also visits the Angkor Wat temple and joins a rice barge to travel down the Mekong River.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling down the Mekong River to Vietnam, where the local diet features an abundance of herbs, freshwater fish and flavoursome soups. As well as following in the footsteps of his hero Graham Greene in Saigon, he is reunited with a former employee in Hanoi to try out the capital city's street food, and samples the produce on offer at the night-time stalls in Bangkok, Thailand.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Thailand where he meets one of his heroes, David Thompson, who has devoted himself to understanding Thai cuisine. He also takes a train to Phuket to learn the art of hot and sour tom yum goong, and visits Melaka to explore the Nyonya-style cooking.(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Set amidst the burgeoning Seattle alternative music scene of the early '90s, Singles follows a group of twentysomethings as they try to find love and try to come to terms with their passage into adulthood. Arranged as an episodic comedy, the film follows a group of friends who live in the same apartment building and hang out at the same coffee shop. The central couple is Steve Dunne (Campbell Scott) and Linda Powell (Kyra Sedgwick), a pair who meet at an Alice In Chains concert and eventually fall in love. Singles follows the tumultuous relationship between Steve and Linda and their friendship with Janet Livermore (Bridget Fonda), who is trying to win the affection of grunge-rocker Cliff Poncier (Matt Dillon). The film also has a number of cameos, including actors Eric Stoltz, Tom Skerritt, Peter Horton, director Tim Burton and the film's author/director, Cameron Crowe. From the musical side of the fence, Singles features appearances by Sub Pop executive Bruce Pavitt, musicians Chris Cornell (Soundgarden), Pat DiNizio (Smithereens), Tad (Tad), and Pearl Jam's Eddie Vedder, Jeff Ament, and Stone Gossard, who play Dillon's backing band, Citizen Dick(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: Fall to Grace
programme.desc: A profile of former New Jersey governor Jim McGreevey, who resigned from office in 2004 after announcing he was gay, but started a new life by studying to become an Episcopal priest and offering spiritual guidance to women in prison(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky (Shia LaBeouf) and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes (Megan Fox) are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is the main impediment to them gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero... Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: Aliens in the Attic
programme.desc: A kids' sci-fi comedy-adventure from director John Schultz, penned by British screenwriter Mark Burton (Madagascar, Wallace & Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit). Teen maths whiz Tom Pearson is on holiday with his extended family at a remote lakeside cottage when four small, green extra-terrestrial creatures land on the roof. The aliens are freshly arrived from outer space and don't waste too much time in setting about their goal - the subjugation of mankind. However, it's equally swiftly apparent that their chosen method of conquest - a mind-control device - only works on adults. And so the scene is set for Tom and the other minors to make a brave stand against the incomers on behalf of Earth's human population(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Satan angers two of his ambitious sons who had been hoping to take over the family business when he decides against retirement. Refusing to give up, they travel to Earth to gather sufficient souls to enable them to overthrow their father. So Satan sends his third son - who unfortunately does not seem to have an evil bone in his body - to bring them back(n)

programme.desc: Howard Payne is the taunting psycho threatening LA with high explosives, Jack Traven the agent who's close to catching him. A breakneck recipe for thrills with a breakthrough role for Sandra Bullock(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Winter Is Coming. In the premiere of this adaptation of author George R.R. Martin's "A Song of Ice and Fire" medieval fantasies, King Robert Baratheon journeys north to offer Lord Ned Stark an important position in his court after the death of a trusted mentor. Meanwhile, the exiled Prince Viserys Targaryen uses his sister, Daenerys, as a pawn in his plot to return to power(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Kingsroad. Accompanied by his daughters, Ned rides south to take his place in King Robert's court, but Catelyn remains at Winterfell, praying that Bran will recover. Meanwhile, Tyrion tags along when Jon Snow leaves for the Night's Watch with his uncle; and Daenerys gets advice on how to please her husband(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Lord Snow. Ned finally arrives at King's Landing, but he's aghast to find out from Robert's advisors that the Crown is deep in debt. Meanwhile, Jon Snow gets off to a rough start with the other recruits at Castle Black, but his commitment impresses Tyrion, who clashes with Benjen over the purpose of the Night's Watch; and Catelyn secretly follows Ned to King's Landing, where she airs her suspicions about the Lannisters to her old friend Petyr Baelish(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Cripples, Bastards and Broken Things. Ned Stark investigates Jon Arryn's death, as Viserys learns his sister is not as weak as he thought(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Wolf and the Lion. Ned and Robert clash over the King's order of a preemptive strike against the Targaryens, a defiant stand that leaves the Hand in a precarious position. Meanwhile, Tyrion receives a rude welcome at the Eyrie from Catelyn's sister, Lysa. Sansa catches the eye of a handsome knight and Arya learns of a threat against her father(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: A Golden Crown. As Tyrion employs a risky scheme to escape the Eyrie, Ned Stark makes a shocking discovery about the Lannisters. Strong language and adult scenes. Brought to the screen by acclaimed author DB Weiss (Lucky Wander Boy) and screenwriter David Benioff (25th Hour), Game of Thrones will have a truly epic sweep with Ireland, Scotland and Malta providing locations for the many environments of Westeros(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: You Win or You Die. With conflict looming, Tywin urges Jaime to preserve the Lannisters' future; Ned presses Cersei about the death of Jon Arryn; Jon takes his vows at Castle Black, though he's preoccupied by Benjen's disappearance; Drogo is enraged by a threat to Daenerys; Robert hopes for a smooth transition at King's Landing(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Pointy End. Based on a series of bestselling novels by revered author George RR Martin, this expansive fantasy saga looks set to completely redefine the genre. Set on the mythical continent of Westeros, the series follows several noble families as they vie to rule the land. While the heroes and villains in such tales are usually clearly delineated, the morality underpinning Game of Thrones is infinitely more complex. Featuring full-blooded, multi-faceted characters whose conflicting motivations and ethics are both utterly credible and deeply intriguing, this is a dark, gritty tale of power,(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones

Meanwhile, Tyrion tags along when Jon Snow leaves for the Night's Watch with his uncle; and Daenerys gets advice on how to please her husband(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Lord Snow. Ned finally arrives at King's Landing, but he's aghast to find out from Robert's advisors that the Crown is deep in debt. Meanwhile, Jon Snow gets off to a rough start with the other recruits at Castle Black, but his commitment impresses Tyrion, who clashes with Benjen over the purpose of the Night's Watch; and Catelyn secretly follows Ned to King's Landing, where she airs her suspicions about the Lannisters to her old friend Petyr Baelish(n)

programme.desc: You Win or You Die. programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Pointy End. Based on a series of bestselling novels by revered author George RR Martin, this expansive fantasy saga looks set to completely redefine the genre. Set on the mythical continent of Westeros, the series follows several noble families as they vie to rule the land. While the heroes and villains in such tales are usually clearly delineated, the morality underpinning Game of Thrones is infinitely more complex. Featuring full-blooded, multi-faceted characters whose conflicting motivations and ethics are both utterly credible and deeply intriguing, this is a dark, gritty tale of power,(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A neighborhood in South Central L.A. provides the setting for this comedy. Lazy Craig would rather hang out with his pothead pal Smokey than look for a job. After Smokey smokes the dope he was meant to sell, he and Craig try to devise ways to pay his dealer back(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: A single father who has just found success as the host of an outrageous television talk show begins to question his path in life when he returns home to attend his parents' 50th wedding anniversary party in the company of his famous fiancée -- a reality television star -- in this crisis-of-conscience comedy starring Martin Lawrence. RJ Stevens (Lawrence) is a television talk-show sensation who has transcended his modest Southern beginnings to become the most popular self-help guru ever to grace the small screen. His show, "Team of Me," is a ratings juggernaut, his fiancée is a beautiful reality television star, and his pockets are always lined with large bills. There are few Tinseltown dreams that RJ hasn't already achieved, so when his parents announce their 50th wedding anniversary, the family-oriented television star immediately drops everything and sets his sights on Georgia. As a boy, RJ was always the target of ridicule within his family, but these days things are different; not only does RJ have a ten-year-old son, but his bride-to-be is admired by countless viewers all across the globe on a weekly basis. But RJ's egotistical West Coast attitude simply doesn't fly in the South, and when his lovable but relentless family refuses to cut him any slack due to his current superstar status, he must finally pause and take stock of the man he has become. Louis C.K., Cedric the Entertainer, Michael Clarke Duncan, and James Earl Jones co-star in a Southern-flavored family comedy written and directed by Malcolm D. Lee(n)

programme.title: Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
programme.desc: Aussie comic Jim Jefferies brings the act which made him such a star on the UK circuit to a grateful audience in the US for his first HBO special(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: Love crosses international boundaries and makes a big mess en route in this romantic comedy. Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Leon) is from Latin America, and Elena Dubrovnik (Elika Portnoy) is from Russia. Carlos and Elena are in love and living in the United States, but while they'd like to stay, they have a problem -- their visas are soon to expire, and they aren't sure when or if they'll be able to get green cards that will allow them permanent residence. Carlos and Elena are close friends with Mike White (McCaleb Burnett) and Betty Bristol (Ashley Wolfe), who were born and raised in the States. Like Carlos and Elena, Mike and Betty are planning to marry but haven't done so yet, and when they learn of their friends' dilemma, someone comes up with a solution -- Carlos will marry Betty, Mike will marry Elena, and once their respective green cards come through, both couples will divorce and everyone lives happily ever after. However, the plan doesn't go as smoothly as expected -- suspicious immigration agents are keeping a close watch on Carlos and Elena, so the newlyweds have to live with their respective spouses and act happily married in order to maintain the illusion of matrimony, which leads the four friends into a variety of romantic complications. Immigration Tango received its world premiere at the 2010 Boston International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Ernest Scared Stupid
programme.desc: The troll who menaced a community returns generations later to harrass the last surviving descendant, village idiot Ernest P Worrell. Comedy for the kids(n)

programme.title: Grumpier Old Men
